  1 <?php
  2 
  3 namespace UserFrosting;
  4 
  5 /**
  6  * Notification Class
  7  *
  8  * A class for sending email/message notifications to users.  For now, only supports email recipients.
  9  *
 10  * @package UserFrosting
 11  * @author Alex Weissman
 12  * @link http://www.userfrosting.com/
 13  */
 14 class Notification {
 15     
 16     /**
 17      * @var Slim The Slim app, containing configuration info
 18      */
 19     public static $app;
 20     
 21     /**
 22      * @var Twig_Template The Twig template object, to source the content for this message.
 23      */
 24     protected $template;
 25 
 26     /**
 27      * @var string The email address that this notification should come from, for email notifications.
 28      */
 29     protected $from_email = "";
 30     
 31     /**
 32      * @var string The name that this notification should come from, for email notifications.
 33      */    
 34     protected $from_name = "";
 35     
 36     /**
 37      * @var string The reply-to email for this notification, for email notifications.
 38      */    
 39     protected $reply_to_email = "";
 40     
 41     /**
 42      * @var string The reply-to name for this notification, for email notifications.
 43      */       
 44     protected $reply_to_name = "";
 45     
 46     /**
 47      * @var array[EmailRecipient] A list of email recipients for this notification.
 48      */       
 49     protected $email_recipients = [];
 50     
 51     /**
 52      * Create a new Notification instance.
 53      *
 54      * @param Twig_Template $template The Twig template object to use to create this notification.
 55      * @todo Allow other content sources (string, database, etc)
 56      */
 57     public function __construct($template){
 58         $this->template = $template;
 59         if (!static::$app)
 60             static::$app = UserFrosting::getInstance();
 61     }
 62 
 63     /**
 64      * Set the sender of this notification as the website.
 65      *
 66      * This uses the site setting "admin_email" as the "from" field, and "site_title" as the "from" name.
 67      * @param string $reply_to_email The reply-to email address.  Will default to the admin_email if not set.
 68      * @param string $reply_to_name The reply-to name.  Will default to the site_title if not set.     
 69      */
 70     public function fromWebsite($reply_to_email = null, $reply_to_name = null){
 71         $this->from_email = static::$app->site->admin_email;
 72         $this->from_name = static::$app->site->site_title;
 73         $this->reply_to_email = $reply_to_email ? $reply_to_email : static::$app->site->admin_email;
 74         $this->reply_to_name = $reply_to_name ? $reply_to_name : static::$app->site->site_title;
 75     }
 76 
 77     /**
 78      * Set the sender of this notification as a specific user
 79      *
 80      * For email, this uses the user's email as the "from" and "reply-to" emails, and the user's display_name as the "from" and "reply-to" names.
 81      * @param User $user The user to send from.   
 82      */     
 83     public function fromUser($user){
 84         $this->from_email = $this->reply_to_email = $user->email;
 85         $this->from_name = $this->reply_to_name = $user->display_name;
 86     }
 87     
 88     /**
 89      * Set the sender of this notification as an arbitary email address and name.
 90      *
 91      * This uses the site setting "admin_email" as the "from" field, and "site_title" as the "from" name.
 92      * @param string $email The sender email address.
 93      * @param string $name The sender name.
 94      * @param string $reply_to_email The reply-to email address.  Will default to $email if not set.
 95      * @param string $reply_to_name The reply-to name.  Will default to $name if not set.     
 96      */    
 97     public function from($email, $name = "", $reply_to_email = null, $reply_to_name = null){
 98         $this->from_email = $email;
 99         $this->from_name = $name;
100         $this->reply_to_email = $reply_to_email ? $reply_to_email : $email;
101         $this->reply_to_name = $reply_to_name ? $reply_to_name : $name;
102     }    
103     
104     /**
105      * Add an email recipient.
106      *
107      * Each "recipient" added with this method will be sent out as a separate email.  To CC or BCC recipients on the same email,
108      * use the ->cc and ->bcc methods on the EmailRecipient object returned by this method.
109      * @param string $email The primary recipient email address.
110      * @param string $name The primary recipient name.
111      * @param array $params An array of template parameters to render the email message with for this particular recipient.
112      * @return EmailRecipient The EmailRecipient object created for this recipient, which you can call ->cc() or ->bcc() on to add CC and BCC.
113      */
114     public function addEmailRecipient($email, $name = "", $params = []){
115         $r = new EmailRecipient($email, $name, $params);
116         $this->email_recipients[] = $r;
117         return $r;
118     }
119     
120     /**
121      * Send the notification.
122      *
123      * This method sends the notification to all recipients, rendering the template with the corresponding parameters for each recipient.
124      * @throws phpmailerException The message could not be sent.
125      */
126     public function send(){
127         $mail = new \PHPMailer(true);
128         
129         $mail->From = $this->from_email;
130         $mail->FromName = $this->from_name;
131         $mail->addReplyTo($this->reply_to_email, $this->reply_to_name);
132         
133         $twig = static::$app->view()->getEnvironment();
134         
135         // Loop through email recipients, sending customized content to each one
136         foreach ($this->email_recipients as $recipient){
137             $mail->addAddress($recipient->getEmail(), $recipient->getName());
138             
139             // Add any CCs and BCCs
140             if ($recipient->getCCs()){
141                 foreach($recipient->getCCs() as $cc){
142                     $mail->addCC($cc['email'], $cc['name']);
143                 }
144             }
145             
146             if ($recipient->getBCCs()){
147                 foreach($recipient->getBCCs() as $bcc){
148                     $mail->addBCC($bcc['email'], $bcc['name']);
149                 }
150             }
151             
152             $params = $recipient->getParams();
153             
154             // Must manually merge in global variables for block rendering
155             $params = array_merge($twig->getGlobals(), $params);
156             $mail->Subject = $this->template->renderBlock('subject', $params);
157             $mail->Body    = $this->template->renderBlock('body', $params);
158             
159             $mail->isHTML(true);                                  // Set email format to HTML       
160             
161             // Send mail as SMTP, if desired
162             if (static::$app->config('mail') == 'smtp'){
163                 $config = static::$app->config('smtp');
164                 $mail->isSMTP(true);
165                 $mail->Host =       $config['host'];
166                 $mail->Port =       $config['port'];
167                 $mail->SMTPAuth =   $config['auth'];
168                 $mail->SMTPSecure = $config['secure'];
169                 $mail->Username =   $config['user'];
170                 $mail->Password =   $config['pass'];
171             }
172             
173             // Try to send the mail.  Will throw an exception on failure.
174             $mail->send();
175             
176             // Clear all PHPMailer recipients (from the message for this iteration)
177             $mail->clearAllRecipients();
178         }
179     }
180 }
181
